wikipedia_page.main: Alfred Edward John Rawlinson (called Jack; 17 July 1884 – 17 July 1960) was an eminent British scholar of divinity and an Anglican bishop. He was the second Bishop of Derby (a diocesan bishop in the Church of England) from 1936 until his retirement in 1959.

response: * Sir Alfred Rawlinson, 3rd Baronet (1867–1934), British pioneer motorist and aviator, soldier and intelligence officer
* Sir Alfred Rawlinson, 3rd Baronet (1867–1934), English soldier, aviator and Olympic sportsman
* 1929–1936: Alfred Rawlinson, Canon of Durham and bishop's examining chaplain (afterwards Bishop of Derby)

link_mentions.page: Rolls Royce Battle of Britain Memorial Window
response: The window was unveiled on 11 January 1949 in Rolls-Royce's Nightingale Road factory in Osmaston, Derby, by Arthur Tedder, 1st Baron Tedder, and dedicated by Alfred Rawlinson, the then Bishop of Derby, from when it remained on display.
